titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6275) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide individuals temporary relief from the alternative minimum tax, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-731, by Mr. Welch (VT).
All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 241.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1297.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1297, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1297 and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Sessions demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1297 until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 194 (Roll no. 451).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 193 (Roll no. 452).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/24/2008--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6275) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide individuals temporary relief from the alternative minimum tax.
